of whole blood into a 10 ml volume centrifuge tube.

Add
of dextran solution and mix well by drawing in and out of a pipette.

source.description:
Incubate in the dark for
at

Place
of Fycoll-HyPaque media solution into a 10 ml volume centrifuge tube.
Slowly and carefully layer the supernatant from blood/dextran mixture onto the Fycoll-HyPaque media solution.

source.body: Important: when layering the sample, do not mix the Fycoll-HyPaque media solution and supernatant.

source.description:
Centrifuge at
with no brake.
Draw off the mononuclear cell layer at the Ficoll/plasma interface along with plasma and Ficoll media, leaving the white cell layer of granulocytes above the red blood cell layer undisturbed.

Resuspend the remaining cell layer in
of NaCl 0.15 M and centrifuge at

source.description:
Mix
of cell suspention with an equal amount of Türk solution (diluition factor=2) allow mixture
at Room temperature (RT).
Take
of the mixture and place it inside a Bürker chamber and view under an optical microscope using 40x magnifiation
Count cell in each square found in the four corners and in the central square (figure 1 below), including those that lie on the bottom and left-hand perimeters, but not those that lie on the top and right hand perimeters (see figure 2 below).
Total number of cell per ml = mean number of cell x diluition factor x 104 (hemacitometer volume)

source.title: SOLUTION- 08 - Türk solution

source.document: {"blocks":[{"key":"ag0le","text":"T\u00fcrk solution composition (v\/v): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":25,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3iqah","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"371rg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9tjcb","text":"- Gentian Violet 0.02%","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5rvsa","text":"- Acetic Acid 3% prepared in H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3buj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"sr0h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b7m7f","text":"Storage:4\u00b0C in the dark covered with aluminum foil (photosensitive)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":8,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":16,"offset":51,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"31qrp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"18q7j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4407u","text":"Gentian violet: Marco Viti","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":15,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3eiec","text":"Acetic acid catalog number: A6283 Sigma Italy","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":27,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eqcna","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

OPTIONAL STEP
For automatic cell count with Cellometer machines use Trypan Blue. The machine will calculate the number of cells /ml and the % of viability.
Take
of cell suspension and add an equal amount of Trypan Blue. Use all the volume to place it in a counting chamber. Place the chamber inside Cellometer and count.

source.document: {"blocks":[{"key":"2v234","text":"Trypan Blue solution 0.4%","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":25,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1o0c4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c8i7q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f9joa","text":"Prepare a dilution at 0.2%(v\/v): 0.4 mL of Trypan stock solution + 0.6 mL PBS or NaCl (final volume 1mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fsuoh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d8kin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c23gp","text":"Storage: 4\u00b0C in the dark (Prepare fresh every 2 weeks)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":29,"offset":25,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1kqhv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fg2at","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2qbng","text":"Trypan blue catalog number: T8154-100mLSigma Italy","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":27,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ekvmp","text":"This recepe is used in the following protocols:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ebip5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bae3c","text":"- PBMC- 01a - Isolation of Human PBMC from Buffy Coat","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":14,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9h426","text":"- PBMC- 01b - Isolation of Human PBMC from Whole Blood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":14,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eadol","text":"- PBMC- 02 - CD4+ T cell Isolation from PBMC with \u201cDynabeads CD4 Positive Isolation Kit\u201d","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4mvil","text":"- PBMC- 03 - TEFF+TREG Isolation from PBMC with \u201cMiltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit\u201d","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":12,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c38fg","text":"- PMN- 01a - Isolation of Human PMN from Buffy Coat","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b27co","text":"- PMN- 01b - Isolation of Human PMN from Whole Blood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9pi2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

OPTIONAL STEP
If needed, check the purity of PMN suspension by using morphological parameters of the flow cytometer.
For this test 0,5x106 PMN in
of PBS are enough.

1.44 g (10 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rtbf","text":"KH2PO4 - 0.24 g (1.8 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1aiq9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2nh4k","text":"To prepare 1 L of PBS 1X, dissolve the reagents listed above in 800 mL of ultrapure H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9d7ao","text":"Adjust the pH to 7.4 with HCl or NaOH, and then add H2O to 1 L.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1vrqp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8epja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a05d8","text":"NaCl code: S9625, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dl8qu","text":"KCl code: P9541, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"19msp","text":"Na2HPO4 code: 1.06585, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4cko6","text":"KH2PO4 code: P0662, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3f8u5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cmlsp","text":"Fonte: (Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Press 2006)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":49,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

EXPECTED RESULTS

source.body:
VIABILITY: the expeted viability by Trypan Blue shuold be ≥90%
CELL YIELD: ± 1 x106 cells starting from 1 mL of Whole Blood

description:
List of published papers using this protocol:
- Boydum A.Isolation of mononuclear cells and granulocytes from human blood. Scand.J.Clin.Lab. Invest. 21 (Suppl.97): 77-89, 1968
- Alex Mabou Tagne, Franca Marino, Massimiliano Legnaro, Alessandra Luini, Barbara Pacchetti and Marco Cosentino. A Novel Standardized Cannabis sativa L. Extract and Its Constituent Cannabidiol Inhibit Human Polymorphonuclear Leukocyte Functions. Int J Mol Sci2019 Apr; 20(8): 1833. Published online 2019 Apr 13. doi: 10.3390/ijms20081833.
- Angela Scanzano, Laura Schembri, Emanuela Rasini, Alessandra Luini, Jessica Dallatorre, Massimiliano Legnaro, Raffaella Bombelli, Terenzio Congiu, Marco Cosentino, Franca Marino. Adrenergic Modulation of Migration, CD11b and CD18 Expression, ROS and interleukin-8 Production by Human Polymorphonuclear Leukocytes. Inflamm Res. 2015 Feb;64(2):127-35. doi: 10.1007/s00011-014-0791-8. Epub 2015 Jan 6.
